meanings.definition: Capable of being reformed or improved.
meanings.sent1: The old car was reformable with a fresh coat of paint.
meanings.sent2: She believed that all students were reformable with proper guidance.
meanings.sent3: The broken toy looked quite reformable after a few repairs.
meanings.sent4: His attitude towards the project became more reformable as he learned new techniques.
meanings.sent5: The garden, once neglected, became a reformable paradise with some care and attention.

meanings.definition: Able to be changed for the better.
meanings.sent1: The stained shirt was reformable after a good wash.
meanings.sent2: The community center was a reformable space for gatherings and events.
meanings.sent3: The recipe was reformable by adding a pinch of salt for flavor.
meanings.sent4: Her perspective on the situation became more reformable after hearing different opinions.
meanings.sent5: The plain room became a reformable oasis with a few decorations and plants.
